did.abstract: A bound volume of clippings pasted in on the Boston subway mainly from the Boston Globe.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Scrapbook of Clippings on the Boston Subway, Crerar Ms 291, Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: This is a bound volume containing newspaper clippings on the Boston Subway. The articles are hand-dated and arranged chronologically. The first articles thus deal with the subway’s construction, and the later articles describe its function, enhancements and expansion. Some of the articles also contain illustrations depicting rail stations, subway riders, and system maps. There are also several features on conductors. Several of the articles are opinion pieces about the proper use and potential changes to the system.
